properties.name: Andrew Haydon Park
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect  Acres Road and Carling Avenue, Ottawa, ONAndrew Haydon Park sports a very cool band shell and hosts a ton of great live music activities in the National Capital Region. Canada Day 2006 is the date for The Apollo Effect\'s first landing at the excellent outdoor venue.

properties.name: Big Bucks Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect33-30 South Service Road, Burlington, ONA Burlington institution for live music. We\'re honoured to have rocked it\'s stage, and rocked it well.

properties.name: Ciao Edie
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect489 College Street, Toronto, ONAt the edge of Little Italy lies one the longest running, and coolest, lounges in Toronto: Ciao Edie. It was hear, with our very good friend Stephen Stanely, that we shook the house and moved the crowd. We were so on fire that night they had to send the authorities to shut the party down. Ciao baby...

properties.name: Club 279 @ The Hard Rock Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect 279 Yonge Street, Toronto, ONLocated above the dining institution, Club 279 is a cool room with a huge sound system. We rocked the Hard Rock. We rocked it hard. Yonge Street will never be the same. We will rock it again very, very soon.

properties.name: Crowbar
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect577 king st. w., toronto, onAhh the Crowbar. How good to us they\'ve been. Scott and his gang have quickly made their mark on the Toronto live music scene and a very cool bar, in a very cool neighbourhood, that gets very cool acts (like us!) all the time.

properties.name: Day 15: The El Mocambo
properties.description: Posted by Murmur464 spadina ave, toronto, on, canada

properties.name: Jeff Healey's
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect178 Bathurst Street, Toronto, ONOwned and operated by the man, the myth, the guitar slinging legend: Jeff Healey. This bar oozes the mystique of all the brilliant musicians that have passed through it. And on March 31, 2006 The Apollo Effect added their charm, their rocking good wit and their amazing music to it\'s ever growing vibe of cool.

properties.name: Lee's Palace
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect529 Bloor Street West, Toronto, ONWe played here on September 6th, 2006.

properties.name: Milner's
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect484 Plains Road East, Burlington, ONMilner\'s hosted The Apollo Effect as part of The Rogers Spring Music Festival. We had an awesome time in Burlington and plan to return to the rockin\' suburbs real soon.

properties.name: Round Sound Studios
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect60 Pippin Road, Concord, ONThe Apollo Effect recorded additional piano and vocal tracks for their debut CD here. All mixing and mastering was done here by Danny Sustar.

properties.name: Stone's Place
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect1255 Queen Street West, Toronto, ONNamed after, you guessed it: The Rolling Stones. If this Stones-themed bar is cool enough to get Mick and boy\'s blessing, it\'s cool enough to handle a TAE show!

properties.name: The Circus Room
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect King Street East and Stirling Ave, Kitchener, ONThe Apollo Effect\'s first foray into the twin towns of Kitchener and Waterloo will be The Circus Room on August 5, 2006. And again on October 27, 2006.

properties.name: The El Mocambo
properties.description: Posted by Theapolloeffect464 Spadina Ave, Toronto, ONThe (in?)famous Toronto live venue. Home to more than a few impromptu Rolling Stone\'s concerts. If you haven\'t been to the El you haven\'t been clubbing in Toronto.
